page.title: 05ARMED FORCES-BURGHFIELD
page.content:
R.O.F. stands for Royal Ordnance Factory. The factory used to be a farm and you can see the outline of the farm house and orchard. It is surrounded by mounds of earth in case of accidents. There is a drain that goes down to the River Kennet. They
have to be careful not to throw poisonous liquids down it. They make explosives for the Royal Air Force. The Burghfield Factory covers 264 acres. There is a 3\ mile fence around the buildings. Around the R.O.F. Burghfield there are poles with wires that act as lightning conductors. They have a small hospital and a firebrigade that put out fires and help people who are injured. When they have thunderstorms they have to take cover under ground.
